alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 17 at 2:15PM CDT until September 17 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: The National Weather Service in Chicago has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Cook County in northeastern Illinois... Northwestern Lake IN County in northwestern Indiana... * Until 500 PM CDT. * At 215 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Rapid-onset flooding of creeks, streams, drainage ditches, streets, underpasses, low-lying areas, and other poor drainage areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Far South side of Chicago, Hammond, Gary, Orland Park, Tinley Park, Calumet City, Chicago Heights, East Chicago, Lansing, Oak Forest, Harvey, Homer Glen, Blue Island, Munster, Dolton, Park Forest, Homewood, Alsip, Matteson and Frankfort. Ongoing flooding reported near Calumet City. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
